Savings Tips. 1  FDA Update: The FDA has asked manufacturers to limit prescription acetaminophen products to 325 mg per dose. 2  Split a Higher Dosage Pill: Cut a higher-dosage pill in half to save 50% or more. 3  Coupon Notice: This drug is a controlled substance. 4  Cheaper Alternative: Less expensive drugs that work the same way may be available.ydrocodone / acetaminophen, lorcet. Hydrocodone / acetaminophen is an opioid / acetaminophen combination used to treat pain. Hydrocodone is an opiate and is considered a narcotic pain medicine. Acetaminophen is sold over the counter for pain and fever.

Photos: Opioids: Addictive painkillers. Hydrocodone â These pills are a more powerful form of codeine, called hydrocodone, and are often mixed with acetaminophen. Hydrocodone is the most frequently prescribed opioid painkiller, according to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, and the most abused.

Vicodin may contain 5 milligrams of hydrocodone and 325 milligrams of acetaminophen or as much as 10 milligrams of hydrocodone and 660 milligrams of acetaminophen. While hydrocodone is the addictive component of this pill, acetaminophen has resulted in serious liver damage at high dosages.

How Hydrocodone Is Used. Hydrocodone is combined with acetaminophen (the active ingredient in Tylenol) or ibuprofen in brand names such as Vicodin, Norco and Lortab. The Food and Drug Administration has also approved a pure hydrocodone product known as Zohydro. Those abusing hydrocodone may crush up their pills and snort or inject the contents.

Acetaminophen, aspirin, and other analgesics that are used in preparations with hydrocodone are called âpotentiators.â The addition of potentiators to hydrocodone pills can lessen the need for high amounts of the addictive opioid substance.

For example, hydrocodone detection time in urine is about 2-4 days (on the safe side) , while hydrocodone can be detected in the hair for up to 3 months after your last pill. Most commercial drug tests for hydrocodone, however, detect hydrocodone in the urine for 6-24 hours after last use.

Hydrocodone begins to work within 10 to 20 minutes of swallowing the pill. Its pain-relieving effects last 4 to 8 hours. Hydrocodone has a half-life of 3 to 4 hours; thatâs how long it takes the body to eliminate half of the drug from the bloodstream. It takes several half-lives to eliminate all the hydrocodone. A small fraction may still be present in the blood a day or so after taking one pill.

Hydrocodone addiction is seen in every age group, with the majority of cases occurring in women between the ages of 20 and 40. Young teens are quickly becoming addicted to the substance because of its ease of availability. It is also an affordable street drug, costing between $2 and $10 per pill.

Vicodin is made of a combination of hydrocodone, a synthetic opiate, and acetaminophen, a non-steroidal pain reliever. Aside from the euphoric and addictive effects of hydrocodone, there is about half a gram of acetaminophen in each pill, and two to four grams of acetaminophen in a day can start to damage the liver.There is a range of effects from Vicodin.side from the euphoric and addictive effects of hydrocodone, there is about half a gram of acetaminophen in each pill, and two to four grams of acetaminophen in a day can start to damage the liver.

Hydrocodone is often in pill form as a acetaminophen (Tylenol)/low dose hydrocodone preperation. Do not drink after having taken even small doses of acetaminophen (tylonel) (found in almost all hydrocodone drug preperations) because it can cause moderate, severe or fatal liver damage.
